comment.body:
Netflix Denmark absolutely sucks, and when Netflix started blocking the VPNs I were using I set up a shadowsocks proxy on a VPS in the U.K., so for now I'm able to watch the British Netflix which is a tad better than the Danish.
If one day Netflix is going to block my shadowsocks proxy I will surely end my Netflix subscription — not to hit Netflix on their bottom line, but simply because the poor selection of films on the Danish Netflix is not worth paying for.

@circle you're right, and if I didn't already have the VPS for some other reason I would already have cancelled my Netflix subscription. Now I'll let it run until I've watched all the films I wanna watch on the British Netflix or until Netflix blocks my VPS – whichever comes first.
I think the film industry and Netflix are most imprudent in their ways of handling this.

> [villoldo](#comment_1_16nZf7G4qaYRtFpHM9MM1A32nV5oqU9TW1): How can I upload/backup files in ZeroNet? I can imagine a way in IPFS, but not here.

If you put the files in the same directory as your zite (or a subfolder of the zite), then sign and publish, your files will be distributed to those who subscribe to your zite.

> [villoldo](#comment_2_16nZf7G4qaYRtFpHM9MM1A32nV5oqU9TW1): Yes, but I doubt that zeronet users will store a site that fill up their harddisk for a longer time.

I agree. However, the answer to your question is still the same. Whether this is an expeditent way of backing up files is another kettle of fish.
